HR PROFESSIONAL

SUMMARY

Dependable Self-motivated and assertive Human Resources Professional with innovative solutions and personal accountability who incorporates quality decision making to facilitate success and who promotes a team-oriented and open-door environment that is conducive to a successful staff.

SKILLS

Staff Recruitment & Retention Employee Relations, retirement Payroll, health and welfare HR Program/Project Management Orientation & on-boarding Training & Development Performance Management Leave of absence and ethics HR Policies & Procedures Organizational Development
Core Competencies
Extensive people's skill and outstanding communicating skills to drive effectiveness.
Concrete skill trained in HR in the capacity of HR assistant for 3 years and more than 12 years hands-on experience in customer and financial services.
Experience in the administration of benefits and compensation programs and other Human Resources programs.
Quickly learn procedures and methods, with exceptional organizational skills.
Evidence of the practice of a high level of confidentiality and trustworthiness.
Proven experienced team player bringing enthusiasm and energy into group efforts.

EXPERIENCE

HR Professional

04/2013 to 06/2014

City ,

Respond to and resolve issues or questions raised by employees or leaders regarding benefits, payroll, HR policies/procedures, general transactions or other HR-related activities.

Provide accurate information and counsel to employees and/or people leaders on their questions and issues, escalating when appropriate.
Act as the first point of contact for employee/manager questions - Confirmation of employments with various external agencies and liaise with third party callers.
Trainer for new employees and new procedures.
Handles highly sensitive and confidential information on a daily basis, an acts as a liaison between customer and 2nd level support.
Assist employees with all matters regarding leaves, including short-term disability and long term disability, and assist employees with questions and concerns regarding, work environment, problems with management, leave of absence, resignations etc.
Thoroughly document and record all inquiries and resolutions within the information tracking database to ensure the recording of complete information for future reference and archival purposes.
Document escalation issues including party to whom matter was escalated.
Begin applying troubleshooting techniques to issues that are more complex in nature; determine when escalation to a team leader or specialist is appropriate to the situation.
Process HR and/or payroll transactions in the HR Management System (HRMS) Validate accuracy of all transactions, particularly those affecting employee levels, pay or benefits.
Receive and make telephone calls to respond to, and resolve customer inquiries and concerns.

Employee recruiting strategy Developed and enforced company policy and procedures Developed company personnel policies Facilitated the criminal background check Managed the employee rewards programs, Surveys and research. <JD_START>
Job Title: Director of HR and People Operations

Location: Washington, DC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: General Business, Human Resources, Other

Description:
Acre is proud to be partnered with ImpactAssets, a trailblazing impact investor that is dedicated to changing the trajectory of our planet's future and improving the lives of all people. Since their founding in 2010, they have raised $3B+ in funds which are being deployed in a variety of ways to tackle challenging issues in climate solutions, racial equity, gender equality, and more. We are looking for a Director of HR and People Operations to usher them into their new phase of growth. If you are an entrepreneurial HR leader with experience in the financial services industry and a passion for driving global change, please read the job description below: SummaryAs the Director of HR and People Operations, you will play a pivotal role in driving the growth and success of our organization by leading our human resources function and managing a small team of specialized HR professionals to operationalize HR programs and services. You will be responsible for developing and implementing HR strategies and programs that align with our business objectives and support our ambitious growth plans. This role spans tactical to strategic, owning and administering the HR function end-to-end while supporting internal partners to facilitate organization growth and achievement of goals. This role is key in guiding and contributing to living our values and embodying our People-First culture. Key Responsibilities:The Director will design and implement HR Operations, and collaborate with the Talent Development and Culture manager to operationalize People Programs as listed below: HR OperationsStrategic HR Planning: Develop and execute HR strategies and initiatives that align with the company's culture and support overall business objectives/growth plans. This includes workforce planning to ensure headcount growth is aligned with budgets and organizational capacity needs.HR Operations: Oversee day-to-day HR operations, including payroll, benefits administration, visa sponsorship, employee records management, and HRIS maintenance. Streamline processes and implement technology solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness.Talent Acquisition and Retention: Oversee the recruitment and hiring process, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding new talent. This includes managing tight timelines and leveraging outsourced recruiting partners. Implement effective retention strategies to attract and retain top talent.Employee Relations: Serve as a trusted resource to managers and employees, providing support and resources for career development, performance management, team management, and other employee relations issues. Leverages Clifton Strengths methodology.Compensation and Benefits: Develop and administer competitive compensation and benefits programs to attract and retain top talent. Monitor industry trends and evaluate the competitive landscape and create strategies to adapt to changing market trends to ensure that our compensation and benefits offerings remain competitive.Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws, regulations, and company policies. Stay updated on changes in legislation and best practices to minimize risks and maintain a positive work environment.Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: Drive initiatives to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion within the organization. Develop strategies to build a diverse workforce and foster an inclusive culture where all employees feel valued and empowered.Technology and Metrics: Own and evolve the people-related tech stack including recruiting, HRIS, and learning management systems to ensure integrated systems that scale efficiently as the organization continues to scale. Track people data and analytics to ensure data-driven decision-making, incorporating qualitative and quantitative feedback from engagement surveys, 1:1s, and other sources into creating effective people programs. People Programs OversightOversee the administration of People Programs, which are managed by the Talent and Culture Manager, ensuring alignment with company goals and values.Provide guidance and support to the Talent and Culture Manager in the design and implementation of employee training, development programs, and initiatives to cultivate a positive workplace culture.Collaborate with the Talent and Culture Manager to coordinate employee engagement initiatives and recognition programs. QualificationsEducation and Experience:Bachelor's degree in HR/Business/OD or other related field of study required, advanced degree preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experienceProfessional HR certification preferred (PHR, SPHR or SHRM-SCP)10+ years' experience leading the People/Human Resources function within a high-growth, small to mid-sized organization. Non-profit or impact investing experience preferred. Knowledge and Skill Requirements:Experience working with leaders, providing coaching & feedback, demonstrating the ability to influence and build relationships. Experience utilizing Clifton Strengths framework preferredIn-depth understanding of HR best practices, with the proven ability to move seamlessly from strategy development to executionProven experience leading the HR function in a fast-paced growth environmentDemonstrated understanding of compliance issues, including federal, state, and municipal employment lawsExperience designing and managing a total compensation and benefits strategy that is competitive, equitable, and aligned with the company's valuesExperience working in an HR role in a virtual working environment requiredHigh level of integrity and ability to use good judgmentStrong skills with Microsoft 365 applications including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Teams requiredStrong skills with HRIS and LMS platforms required, ADP Workforce Now preferredProficiency with cloud-based collaboration tools Box and Asana preferred If you would like to be considered for this opportunity, please apply directly here or reach out to Richard Kent at richard.kent@acre.com. ImpactAssets is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We know our organization is at its best when we include, celebrate, and embrace difference. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our mission, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

Experience Level (if available): Director
<JD_END>
